summary:
## Amoebas: Shape-Shifting Cells

Amoebas are single-celled organisms that can change shape by sticking out and pulling back parts of their bodies, called pseudopods. They're found in many different groups of living things, like protozoa, fungi, and even animals.

Once all amoebas were grouped together, but scientists now know they're not closely related. Well-known amoebas include *Amoeba proteus*, used often in classrooms, and *Naegleria fowleri*, a rare but dangerous "brain-eating" amoeba.
title: Amoeba
